description: Gitnuro is the tool I use (besides the git cli), whenever I can't use the git-integration of Jetbrains' IDEs. It's really nice and comfortable to use and has everything I needed so far. It's the tool I recommend whenever someone is starting out with git.
summary: Finally a git GUI that is fun

description: I've tried quite a few Git clients on Linux but this is by far the best. A true dark horse in the FOSS git client arena. Beautiful UI, well designed, and extremely easy to use. It integrates correctly with git-credential-manager, and has several nifty features I look for in a git client like single line stage/unstage, file history, and tabs for multiple repos. Look no further for your Linux Git client.
It has a sleek and easy to understand UI which makes it stand out from the other git clients.
Like a lite version of GitKraken. Missing some rich features but I like it.

Well, it have a nice UI, multiple tabs for projects, good cherry-pick/stash inegration and nice tree view. Personally, I used to SmartGit and GithubDesktop and I would say that Gitnuro is a good alternative. 
Still raw though, no syntax highlighting, couple visual bugs I faced and poor amount of features. But it's in active development so I guess it's my primary Git client now
Nice user interface and tree view, easy to review the code before commit

It just doesn't work on my computer. It gives errors even when just switching to another branch, which works perfectly fine with the command line or other graphical tools.
Otherwise it looks good, has all necessary features, promising tool. Maybe when the errors are fixed it could become a great git client!
Fácil de usar y funciona perfectamente en Fedora 37
Cuando quiero usar fetch con un repositorio que usa SSH siempre muestra un error sin descripción.
Yes is not ideal(new project) but i hope project will be have large community and long-term life
